result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kwan Kim

records.addlTxt: LEVEL 2 JUSTICE POINT SUPERVISION. All other conditions remain.

Defendant Kwan Kim in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Kwan Kim in custody, appearing via zoom.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest the report.   Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  

Court orders LEVEL 2 JUSTICE POINT supervision as an additional signature bond condition. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.
Received and Signed. Order

Defendant Kwan Kim in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Kwan Kim in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Return on Warrant. Discussions put forth on the record. Court is advised by parties there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department, pending completion of evaluation. Court further takes no action as to bail. Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 7-26-2022.  Original bench warrant scanned.  Case is adjourned until August 1, 2022 at 8:30 am for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 16.  Notice is given to Defense Counsel and District Attorney.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a return on Doctor's Report.  Defendant failing to appear.  Parties inform the court that defendant failed to appear at scheduled appointment for evaluation.  Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.
Received and Filed. Letter to the court

ADDRESS INFO for Kwan Kim
Current: 121 Nichols Mill Rd, Downingtown, PA 19335   (Effective: 06-27-2022)
Prior: 5203 South 68th Street #A303, Greendale, WI 53129

Defendant Kwan Kim in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner, via zoom.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties put forth on the record. Court orders defense counsel to re-schedule evaluation and arrange for transportation for the defendant. Case adjourned for Doctor's Report Return to Br 16.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Competency Evaluation No Show Letter

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Doctor's Report Return. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendants appearance has been waived for the purpose of todays hearing. Court addresses the Wisconsin Forensic Unit's competency evaluation extension letter. Due to reasons put forth on the record, defense counsel requests a Status Conference date. No objections from the State. Court grants request and adjourns matter to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed. Competency Evaluation Extension Letter
Received and Signed. Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

Defendant Kwan Kim in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner, via zoom.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Forensic evaluation will take place the Wisconsin Forensic Unit, Room 504 of the Safety Building with Dr. Jenna Gables on 05/23/2022  at 11:00 am. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Email correspondence with parties. Case re-scheduled for Scheduling Conference on 05/09/2022, Br 16.

Defendant Kwan Kim in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kwan Kim appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

OFF THE RECORD: Parties are not present.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing 2/22/2022. Milwaukee County Office of Emergency Management declared a snow emergency for 2/22/2022 therefore this matter will be rescheduled. A new date has been selected with Attorney Gaertner by email. Case is adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant Kwan Kim in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney advised the court that defendant was taken to Mental Health Complex.
Defendant failing to appear, court ordered arrest warrant issued but STAYED issuance until 2/14/2022 at 1:30 p.m  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 007283,
Payable Number: 981248,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/1/22 @ 2p
